title_screen: ^An interactive space opera by Nat Quayle Nelson and Diane Cai

g-0: ^We have entered a ceasefire with the rhizoXls after a swift campaign of human domination. I, Starson the First, led the final crusade at the Horsehead Nebula. The Rhizox prime minister had no choice but to capitulate. Later today, the rhizoX ambassador known as XXX is expected to board the HMS Spaceman to kick off negotiations for their universal surrender. And then tonight, a soirée on our new ally's home planet!

s: ^I have graciously given my crew the day off

c-1: ^ to prepare for festivities. I hope my war engineers, bred for their unrelenting work ethic, are able to enjoy this moment of calm....

g-0: ^...However, it is not my place to conjecture as to how my crew may be diverting themselves.
^. He's been in his compusor a lot lately...

s: ^Starson Two, of my literal flesh and blood, is in his quarters

g-0: ^I've gone over and over the rhizoX diplomat's dossier, looking for a sign that this might be a trap on par with the Trojan Human incident. But that's simply impossible. At this stage, Man's victory over rhizoXl is so full and complete they'd be insane to try any more hostility.
g-1: ^I can't help but admit to myself, gazing idly at his profile pic, this diplomat is kind of cute. Despite the unconventional rhizoX morphology, he has an impressive form that I can't really take my mind off.
g-2: ^to the context of the strategic situation. The text: _Hey man! This is just man to man. Things arent't going so good for me and my boys. We're ready to submit and learn the ways of your human empire. As we prepare to be enfolded in your glorious galactic patriarchy, we now offer unto You our Overlords a final celebration on our home planet. Bring your finest warriors and your greatest warship so we can celebrate the end of this war with a Big Bang! Inferiorly yours, XXX._

diplomatic_meeting: ^My compusor beeps, signalling me to await the ambassador's arrival in the Mouth.

s: ^I radio ahead for them to cue the welcoming music.
^The powerful skunky odor of the rhizoXls as it hits my nose like a tidal wave.

c-2: ^ Do we know each other? No one else seems to notice.
g-0: ^I'm caught off-guard, allowing XXX to speak first. Hmph.

gay_hookup: ^"Well, well, well. You must be The First Star Son." To his daughter, he explains, "The humans, having perfected the genetic makeup of Machismo after milennia of bloody internal conflict, model all their captains after the same chosen bloodline." Her eyes widen and she reverts to a neutral gaze.

g-0: ^"A hunk like you can call me Sonny." Good God! Something in the way he smells has caused my throat muscles to loosen and my carefully rehearsed formality to boil off like so much steam.
^He escalates quickly: "This may be both of our only chances to make love to an alien."

glorious_battle: ^Not the height of Starson glory--that's today--or if all goes as destiny has written it, it will be one day in the future when I'm captaining this Spaceman... No, I was thinking of the days even before space existed. When men, natural-born and without purpose, crawled our own speck of Earth, knowing nothing but the will to fight for what they believed should be theirs.

s: ^Have you ever been nostalgic for a time you didn't live?

g-0: ^"Ah, hm," she replies noncomittally. (Damn he's losing her with all this abstract philosophical talk! Let's keep it to the present and primal.)

s: ^the way it feels to be recriminated by a female.

c-3: ^The first female he's ever seen, even over the Compusor. Before her, he never had a reason to think about women, nary a hint of a desire.

c-0: ^ (It's best to involve women in only those important decisions with limited options so as not to overwhelm.)

p2: ^He remembers a day, at least a decade past, when they'd been doing the usual ship interior navigation drills: Head-shoulders-knees-and-toes. "Start with the head, jog to the shoulders. sprint to the knees, and the last one to the toes gets a bloody nose."
^That last part was just a silly rhyme he and his young compatriots had invented.

A digito-clockworkian-netnerve processor (if he remembers his terminolologoly correctly) that learned to steer the ship itself after training for Untold Epochs. spike_the_air: ^A short walk laterally puts them standing squarely in front of the very lungs to which they owe every breath.

g-7: ^the time Starson II approached him with that goofy grin on his face, saying he wanted Thad to help teach him more about the ship's "engineery parts." ^and it was finally happening, he finally had Starson's attention but it all felt wrong, Thad... after _years_ of crushing on the captain-to-be, Thad suddenly didn't know _what_ he wanted. joyride: ^For the first few moments after their pod is evacuated, all Thad can see looking backward is the Spaceman's sphincter as it re-clenches. It makes him uncomfortable even as Chad seems to be transfixed on its hidden depths. As they float outward, the rear porthole begins to reveal a fuller picture of His two flexed, steely cheeks.

g-0: ^He pops open a military-issue Smore-flavored whiskey. "It makes spacewar just as cozy as an Old Earth camping trip," as the label says.

spaceman: ^As he steers the pod in a wide arc around the ship's waistline, Thad gasps at the imposing figure of the Spaceman's entire front half, standing gallantly astride the vastness of space.

c-0: ^ The first fully humanoid cosmo-vessel, the Measure of All Spacefaring Things. It's fucking beautiful.
g-0: ^Chad: And it's got a mighty fine package.
^Brad: Seeing it from the outside really makes you appreciate how awesome we are. We really deserve to win this war and kill more aliens.
^Thad notes that Brad takes these things too far sometimes. Thad:

s: ^I've never even seen a rhizoXl, though.

g-1: ^Brad: Where's your enthusiasm? Humans are the bomb. There's nothing more glorious than a naked warrior. Our bare form alone is enough to terrify the rhizoXls -- we've won entire battles by taking our clothes off!
g-2: ^Thad: I know that's what they tell us, about our history and everything. Does it really make sense, though? Those old paintings aren't necessarily his'torical documents. And in the Denuded battle, I keep getting hung up on a few details. Yes, the rhizoXls turned and fled as our soldiers disrobed at Starson I's strip command, but they all got away as if they'd been preparing for just that. What if they weren't trying to win the battle?

s: ^Thad: And the Trojan Human incident no one talks about.

That's pretty fucked up.

g-0: ^And there you have it. The peace treaty brokered, we'll soon enter orbit of the rhizoXl homeworld. I look forward to our welcoming party--the diplomat mentioned there would be punch!
^At the end of all this, it's clear to me that
g-1: ^has led us to a place of unmitigated success, although it's not so clear if there was ever any threat of the opposite outcome. Sometimes that's all the captain does: he steers true, along the predestined path of greatness, and he just has to not cock anything up along the way. A "job-does-itself" kind of a thing. But I'm awesome.

penny_thad_4eva: ^As XXX prepares to order the beginning of the total annihilation of an alien race, he seems to be surprised at his daughter's mood. She feels deeply ambivalent, something she's usually better at hiding from him.

s: ^"Maybe seeing the foolish humans' fate she will appreciate the need to get her graduate degree."

g-0: ^He speaks, an attempt at assuaging her doubts. "Penumbra, my daughter. We have accomplished what we set out to do. Do you not rejoice for this fine rhizoX victory? You can return to your life now as it was."
g-1: ^She can sense his fear: that her curiosity, once shiny and bright, has now taken on an edge of cut diamond. He will agree to what she asks.

c-0: ^ We--I could study one. Their genetic modification protocols and reflexive programming and such. I'll open a lab."

^Indeed, he obliges her, and they swing back to pluck out the one she asks for: A strange choice, the man she calls "little Thad," but regardless, XXX is pleased to see his daughter smile again, for the first time showing _every_ row of teeth.

^The H.M.S. Spaceman has met with the worst possible disaster--our prized phallastic thruster has been destroyed in a pathetic last attempt by the rhizoXl traitors to turn the tide of the war. I can smell their desperation, and I will pounce on it. I've instructed my engineers to investigate a new method of interstellar propulsion: The Spaceman shall pull Himself onward by his own bootstraps! Indeed, I have proven myself to be worthy of my title once again.

b: ^that my engineers have stolen Pod #2 and fled the ship along with several weeks worth of our emergency rations.
^that my engineers have all incurred permanent brain damage by ingesting some form of hypertoxic fungus.
^by my engineers that my suggestion is physically impossible.

g-0: ^This is only a small setback in what is to be the most valiant chapter of the H.M.S. Spaceman's story.

c-2: ^_Report from Ambassador XXX to the rhizoX council, Star date X.xXXXxXX.X.X._

g-1: ^Our plan has been a resounding success.

c-3: ^ leaving Him permanently immobilized in space, with nothing to do but but helplessly deplete His air supply, we assumed His crew would simply suffocate over the span of multiple weeks. A second rhizoXl ship was deployed on the scene to ensure the Spaceman incurred no outer damage by passing asteroids during His slow internal demise.

c-0: ^ we were surprised by the eagerness with which the Spaceman's crew descended into total chaos, first violently deposing their captain, and next, brutally rioting. If their crew continues to die at the current rate, we should be clear to proceed with our plans to recover the ship and deliver it to the rhizoXl Museum of eXtincted Species by next XxxDay.
